name: Hilton Head Marriott Resort & Spa

reviews.text: It was very nice. The spa was fun and relaxing. Got a facial and it was great. Conroy's was good. Breakfast Buffet at the Cafe was yummy. The Ocean Blu was good food but bad. I ordered a VIRGIN Mango Daquri, came out 10 mintutes later and I drank the whole thing. After like 2 mins. after I drank it, I said " Mom, I dont feel well. Can I jump in the pool?" And she said yes and I did but then they ordered me another and all of them ( mom, dad, mom's friend and my bro) tasted it and it had rum in BOTH of them so I had to lay down and i fell asleep. So I was all woozy and kawampaty the rest of the day. Anyway, Everything was great and their staff other than the Ocean Blu staff was polite, sweet and always was happy and on the job.
reviews.title: BAD DAY!! Rest was great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the Hilton Head Airport (KHXD), our taxi promptly whisked us to the Marriott Resort (Hotel) 3 miles away. We checked in early and Brian, our front desk person, was very accommodating. I had reserved an "island view" but after much clicking, Brian put us in and ocean view (not ocean front). Pays to be nice. Good enough. Only one minor irritation: it was the third room key that actually worked. Overall, the service was excellent in all areas. I guess I expected less from such a large resort. (The cab driver told us Marriott has 13 properties on the island. This one is the "hotel." It doesn't say anything on the property about "Hotel & Spa." Says "Marriott Resort, Golf," etc. but no Spa signs.) The room was on the side on the third floor yet angled to face the beach. Great view of the beach. Was kinda glad we didn't get an ocean front room. They all face the large pool/bar areas, which are - I imagine - quite noisy if you want to take a nap during the day. A day on the beach with 2 chairs and an umbrella will cost you $18 plus tip. Great beach, warm water at the time (85 degrees). The bar "Liquid" is just above the beach and service was good. Quite easy to charge everything to the room. As far as dining at the Resort, we tried Conroy's but it was a busy "reservations only" night so we ate "bar food" outside at Ocean Blue which overlooks the ocean as it's name implies. Quite nice and the food was pretty good. The resort has a "grocery store" if you want to save money on water, sodas, etc. The pools were clean, numerous, and large. The towel lady has been there 30 plus years and was very nice. Again, starting with Brian, every employee was very nice (including the gal who evicted us from our beach chairs in the late afternoon). For a family resort, the employee attitudes were remarkable considering all of the yelling, screaming kids around. (Not that bad, just noticable. There are many ways to get away from "kiddie noise" at this Resort.) The room was clean and the king bed was plush. The room had a shower only, which I thought was odd (not that we wanted to take a bath), and the glass door opens and can possibly hit the bathroom door, so we had to be mindful. As far as transportation on the island, there are many miles of bike trails and there's a shuttle to the local mall. Many people talked about the constant insect infestation on the island, but we didn't see any evidence of this either at the Resort or anywhere else on the Island. In conclusion, this is one of the best "something for everybody" type resorts I've stayed at. They are able to pull it off with little compromise. When we go back to Hilton Head, we'll stay there again. The "first impression" was good enough so that I won't spend the time or energy seeing if there are other places we might want to stay at on the Island.
reviews.title: We'd stay again!

likes.liked: — Front desk Brian and the rest of the friendly staff.

reviews.text: I stayed here for a conference, so i did not select this property. However, I would not recommend this to anyone for a vacation. The rooms are quite small There is no refridgerator, no micro. There are nice robes, but my room didn't even have a hook in the bathroom to hang the robe! Soeaking of bathroom, the shower (nice and roomy) was dirty and smelled like mildewed mops. Our view was of the rooftop of the indoor pool. COMPLETELY obstructed view. Now I know bad views are "luck of the draw', but you would think hotels would let you know and perhaps offer a discount for such a room. The cafe lunch was adequate but pricey, service was slow slow slow. The pool bar was closed up tight at 7:30 (that's what time we went, not sure when it actually closed) There are nicer properties on HH for same $$. Why would you stay here?
reviews.title: A disappointment for the price

likes.disliked: — no better than a discount hotel room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at this hotel after doing a short notice bidding on a resort room. We were able to get this room for just under half the listed web price.
reviews.title: Interesting Roof View

reviews.text: Upon check in we were greeted by very friendly staff and were told there were only rooms available with two double beds so they were unable to supply us with a king. On our way up to the room the fire alarm went off and we ignored it. It shut off around 5 minutes later. Although our room was clean, it overlooked the 3rd floor roof and the balcony was useless. Luckily we were only on the third floor of this hotel because the elevators are some of the slowest I've ever seen, and then when they do arrive they are usually full.
reviews.title: Great stay. Very Family Friendly

reviews.text: Besides having a view of the restaurant exhaust system and a garage wall, I woke up early on the last morning of my 3 night stay to wet clothes from an inch of water in my room as a result of an air conditioning or condensation problem. I was offered a mere $50 credit. A credit they expected me to spend at their hotel evidently. The front desk proceeded to reduce that credit to $20 by charging me $10 per day for parking Complimentary parking is shown on their webpage. Had I had not been among business colleagues I would have made a forceful insistence to compensate appropriately. Instead, I have decided to use a quiet approach to advertise how they treated me.
reviews.title: Poor treatment to Priceliner

likes.liked: — the view from the public spaces
likes.disliked: — check out staffs' lie about complimentary parking and pitiful offer of compensation

reviews.title: This is how you should be treated

reviews.title: Great customer service, but everything else wasn't so

likes.disliked: — The rooms and dirt in the hallways

reviews.text: I was pretty nervous after reading some of the recent reviews - but I have to tell you I was so pleasantly surprised!!
reviews.title: Fantastic stay!!

likes.liked: — Location (right on the beach), very friendly and helpful staff, perfect place for small children
likes.disliked: — Bug in the bathroom - really grossed me out

reviews.text: My first impression was that the hotel was absolutely beautiful. The staff was so friendly and literally bent over backwards trying to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. They upgraded us to ocean view rooms although they were not connecting as I requested. I told them I would rather have the connecting rooms since I had my parents and small children with me. It took a while but they gave us ocean view connecting rooms. And then later that evening they brought up a bottle of wine and some cheese and crackers. Nice!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

reviews.text: The staff went out of their way to ask us how we were doing and if there was anything they could do to help - EVERY day! It was so nice. All of them - front desk, bellboy, waitress at the pool, random management walking around the property, everyone!! Really made my parents feel relaxed, which made them want to watch the kids, which made my husband and myself relax. A win for everyone!! :-)
reviews.title: Great pool with beach view
Avoid at All Cost
reviews.text: There were about 4 or 5 different activities for the kids each day. They made art projects, played water basketball, watched movies in the indoor pool, went down a blown-up waterslide on the beach, etc. There was food service at the pool, which was great. The food at the restaurants as well as at the pool was actually really good, too. My kids (5 and 3) loved all the pools - baby pool, big outdoor pool, and indoor pool. They had so much fun!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a great vacation. I would definitely recommend highly to anyone. The only reason I didn't give it a rating of Excellent is because of the two following issues:
reviews.title: Disappointed in this Marriott property

reviews.text: Very nice property!. As well located as any on Hilton Head. Staff was extremely friendly, many activities for children. Great pool area and beach. A couple complaints--room while accomodating was not great and not a Hilton. Rather small with no refrigerator or microwave. Two queens were cramped for 4 people. Also, did see roaches on property, including room. Balcony had not been cleaned and had old cigarette butts on floor. Internet $9.95 per day in room plus resort charge and parking charge. Bellhops were not very attentive. Watched as we unloaded car and loaded car without offering any help. Also, convenience store in hotel was outrageous!! 20oz bottle water was $4.00!! Candy bar $3.00. Disney World prices. General Store is short walk from hotel and has much more at more reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Nice, not great
Maybe three star noway 4 star hotel
reviews.text: Booked through hotwire.com, room was overlooking parking lot with no view at all. Went to front desk to ask for a upgrade. Per the front desk no rooms until, I offer to pay more, and what do you know but a room appeared. I paid $300 more for the week got room 306. First the wireless wouldn't work, which I must have for work. Then nails coming thru carpet at sliding glass doors. Next ceiling linked twice alot not just a little,cause us to miss dinner one night waiting on someone to come fix it. All we got for our trouble was a candy apple. I looked at the guy and said your kidding right. The TV had limited channels not what you would expect from a 4 star hotel. The staff was always friendly almost to the point of being fake. All I can say is stay at the Hilton don't waste your money there.

I booked the room at the Marriot on Price.... for a girl's weekend out trip and was very worried it would be rundown or not good. We had a really good price and the resort is just lovely. Of course our room had no view, we were looking at the roof of the restaurant, but for that great of a price it was not a problem. And we never were in the room except to sleep. The room was a little worn, but the bathroom was nice and large with granite counters. The location is fabulous, right in the middle of Hilton Head. Pool is nice, workout room is very usable and had the basics for a decent workout. The employees were super friendly and helpful. We were able to find chairs by the pool every day, enjoyed the pool side snacks/bar. The hotel seemed family oriented to me, not a party hotel. There were lots of children around the pool, and they had a clown and events scheduled for children. I would recommend this hotel and would go back anytime!
reviews.title: Really nice stay

reviews.text: The hotel has a great location right on the Atlantic. You can walk out of the hotel lobby into the pool area and then onto the beach. The reception area appeared as if it has been renovated and was extremely nice. Our room was in the South wing and you could tell it was ageing.
reviews.title: Great Location
